alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Florence; Marlboro; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 3:58PM EST until January 09 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Florence County in northeastern South Carolina... Western Dillon County in northeastern South Carolina... Darlington County in northeastern South Carolina... Marlboro County in northeastern South Carolina... Western Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 500 PM EST. * At 356 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ansonville to 7 miles northwest of Holly Hill, moving northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Florence, Bennettsville, Hartsville, Lake City, Darlington, Kingstree, Timmonsville, Mccoll, Lamar, Quinby, Clio, Brownsville, Cades, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Chavistown, Floyd, New Hope, North Hartsville, and Effingham. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for northeastern South Carolina.
